cards.text: A simple device for calculating, consisting of a frame with rows of wires or grooves along which beads are slid is ___ .
Napier's bone is a set of graduated rods (as of wood or bone) used for multiplication and division. Yes or No?
Two graduated scales devised in such a way that suitable alignment of one against other makes it possible to calculate is ___ .
A device developed by Blaise Pascal which contains eight dials, gears and wheels is ___ .
cards.tip: It could only do addition and subtraction.

cards.text: A device developed by Gottfried Wilhelm Von Leibniz, a German mathematician and philosopher is ____ .
cards.tip: It could perform all four of the basic arithmetic functions – addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

cards.text: A device designed by Charles Babbage, an English mathematician, in 1822 that could solve equations is ____ .
cards.tip: The name is derived from the method of divided differences.

cards.text: All the modern computers are based on the working principle (input-process-output) of this engine called ____ .
cards.tip: It was built as the successor to difference engine.

cards.text: Hollerith Tabulator is a device that used punched cards for input, output and instructions. Yes or No?
The first electromechanical digital computer was Atanasoff–Berry Computer. Yes or No?
Mark-I is not the first automatic electromechanical computer. Yes or No?
